title: P06-1013

sentences.text: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance .
This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD .
We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems .
Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text .
Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Entity-combination_method.label: Combination methods
Entity-combination_method.description: Combination methods refer to techniques that enhance system performance by integrating multiple strategies, specifically in the context of unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD), utilizing voting and arbiter-based approaches to leverage predominant senses derived from raw text.

Entity-system_combination.label: system combination
Entity-system_combination.description: System combination refers to a technique used to enhance the performance of unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) by integrating multiple WSD systems through various voting and arbiter-based strategies.

Entity-benefit_of_system_combination.label: benefits of system combination
aliases: the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD
Entity-benefit_of_system_combination.description: The 'benefits of system combination' refers to the advantages gained from integrating multiple unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) systems to enhance overall performance, as explored in the context of various combination strategies in the paper.

mentions.local_name: the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD

Entity-our_combination_method.label: Our combination methods
Entity-our_combination_method.description: Our combination methods refer to the strategies employed to enhance the performance of unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) systems by utilizing predominant senses automatically extracted from raw text.

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper investigates the advantages of employing system combination techniques to enhance performance in unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD).

Entity-voting_-_and_arbiter-based_combin.label: voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies
Entity-voting_-_and_arbiter-based_combin.description: Voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies refer to methods that aggregate the outputs of multiple unsupervised word sense disambiguation systems to enhance overall performance by leveraging predominant senses derived from raw text.

Entity-diverse_pool_of_unsupervised_wsd_.label: diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems
aliases: a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems
diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems
Entity-diverse_pool_of_unsupervised_wsd_.description: A diverse collection of unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) systems utilized for evaluating and improving performance through combination strategies.

mentions.local_name: diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems
a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems

Entity-arbiter-based_combination_strateg.label: arbiter-based combination strategies
Entity-arbiter-based_combination_strateg.description: Arbiter-based combination strategies are decision-making methodologies that integrate outputs from multiple unsupervised word sense disambiguation systems to enhance overall performance by selecting the most appropriate sense based on predefined criteria.

Entity-ensemble.label: ensembles
Entity-ensemble.description: The term 'ensembles' refers to a collection of combined unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) systems that utilize voting and arbiter-based strategies to improve performance on various datasets.

Entity-experiment_using_the_semcor_and_s.label: Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets
aliases: Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets
Entity-experiment_using_the_semcor_and_s.description: Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets refer to empirical evaluations conducted to assess the performance of ensemble methods for unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) by utilizing these two annotated corpora.

mentions.local_name: Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets

Entity-voting.label: voting
Entity-voting.description: Voting refers to a strategy used in combination methods for decision-making processes in unsupervised word sense disambiguation (WSD) systems, where multiple systems contribute to a collective decision based on their outputs.

Entity-unsupervised_wsd.label: unsupervised WSD
Entity-unsupervised_wsd.description: Unsupervised WSD refers to a method in natural language processing that aims to determine the correct meaning of words in context without the use of labeled training data.

Entity-semcor_and_senseval-3_data_set.label: SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets
Entity-semcor_and_senseval-3_data_set.description: SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets are annotated corpora used for evaluating word sense disambiguation and other natural language processing tasks.

Entity-senseval-3.label: Senseval-3
Entity-senseval-3.description: Senseval-3 is a linguistic resource and dataset used for evaluating word sense disambiguation systems, consisting of annotated texts with multiple senses for words.

Entity-system_performance.label: system performance
Entity-system_performance.description: System performance refers to the effectiveness and efficiency of a system in executing its intended functions, often measured through various performance metrics.

Entity-wsd.label: WSD
Entity-wsd.description: WSD refers to Word Sense Disambiguation, a process in natural language processing that involves determining which meaning of a word is used in a given context.

Entity-semcor.label: SemCor
Entity-semcor.description: SemCor is a linguistically annotated corpus that provides a resource for word sense disambiguation and other natural language processing tasks.

Entity-raw_text.label: raw text
Entity-raw_text.description: Raw text refers to unprocessed or unformatted textual data that serves as input for various data processing tasks.

Entity-state-of-the-art.label: state-of-the-art
Entity-state-of-the-art.description: state-of-the-art refers to the highest level of development or performance achieved in a particular field, often serving as a benchmark for comparison.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written work that presents research findings, analyses, or arguments, typically published in an academic or professional context.

summary: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance . This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD . We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems . Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text . Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Predicate-improve.label: improve
Predicate-improve.description: The predicate 'improve' indicates a positive change or enhancement in the quality, effectiveness, or efficiency of the object as a result of the actions or characteristics of the subject. It suggests that the subject has a direct influence or capability to elevate the state of the object, leading to better outcomes or results.

Predicate-examines.label: examines
Predicate-examines.description: The predicate 'examines' indicates an action where the subject engages in a detailed investigation or analysis of the object. It implies a systematic approach to understanding, evaluating, or exploring the characteristics, implications, or significance of the object in question.

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: The predicate 'investigate' denotes the action of examining, exploring, or analyzing a subject in order to gain a deeper understanding or to uncover information about an object. In the context of the provided triple, it signifies that the subject is actively engaging in a process to study or assess the object, which may involve various methods or approaches to reveal insights or findings related to the object.

Predicate-over.label: over
Predicate-over.description: The predicate 'over' indicates a relationship of control, influence, or application between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject operates in relation to, or is applied to, the object in a manner that implies a hierarchical or comparative structure.

Predicate-are_investigated_over.label: are investigated over
Predicate-are_investigated_over.description: The predicate 'are investigated over' indicates that the subject is the focus of a study or examination that seeks to explore, analyze, or evaluate its characteristics, performance, or implications in relation to the object. This suggests a relationship where the subject is being scrutinized or assessed in the context of the object, which often represents a broader category, framework, or set of conditions under which the subject is being analyzed.

Predicate-demonstrate.label: demonstrate
Predicate-demonstrate.description: The predicate 'demonstrate' indicates that the subject provides evidence or proof of the existence, validity, or effectiveness of the object. It implies a process of showing or illustrating a particular concept, method, or phenomenon through examples, experiments, or observations.

Predicate-compared_with.label: compared with
Predicate-compared_with.description: The predicate 'compared with' establishes a relationship of evaluation or assessment between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is being measured or analyzed in relation to the object. This comparison often highlights similarities, differences, advantages, or disadvantages, providing a context for understanding the subject's characteristics or performance in relation to the object.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates that the subject is utilized as a resource or tool within the context of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject provides the necessary data, materials, or context that enables the activities, processes, or analyses described by the object.

Predicate-are_compared_with.label: are compared with
Predicate-are_compared_with.description: The predicate 'are compared with' indicates a relationship in which the subject is evaluated or analyzed in relation to the object, highlighting similarities, differences, or performance metrics between the two entities. This comparison often aims to assess the relative quality, effectiveness, or characteristics of the subject in contrast to the object.

Predicate-enhance.label: enhance
Predicate-enhance.description: The predicate 'enhance' signifies an action or process through which the subject improves, increases, or augments the qualities, effectiveness, or performance of the object. In this context, it indicates that the subject contributes positively to the object, resulting in a more advanced or superior state.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under the wider category or concept represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a broader scope or definition that includes the subject as a subset or example.
